snippet: Gazprom, Russia’s state-controlled gas monopoly, signed an accord on Saturday with the government of Japan to continue with plans for construction of a $13 billion natural gas terminal.
abstract: Gazprom, Russia's state-controlled gas monopoly, signs an accord with the Japanese government to move forward with plans for the construction of a $13 billion natural gas terminal in Vladivostok that would propel Russia's ambitions to multiply its business and trade ties in the Far East.
lead_paragraph: Gazprom, Russia’s state-controlled gas monopoly, signed an accord on Saturday with the government of Japan to continue with plans for construction of a $13 billion natural gas terminal.

headline.seo: Russia and Japan Move Forward on Major Natural Gas Deal
headline.main: Russia and Japan in Agreement on Natural Gas Deal
headline.print_headline: Russia and Japan in Agreement on Natural Gas Deal
